snippet: Many who waited to hear Mr. Trump speak said they thought he and Mr. Sanders have some things in common even though they sit on opposite ends of the political spectrum.
abstract: Donald J Trump makes campaign visit to Vermont, part of his effort to broaden his focus beyond early-voting primary states; visit is meant in part to challenge Sen Bernie Sanders in his home state and to show that Trump can attract large crowds in reliably Democratic stronghold in advance of primary in neighboring New Hampshire.

byline.original: By ALAN RAPPEPORT and JESS BIDGOOD

lead_paragraph: Many who waited to hear Mr. Trump speak said they thought he and Mr. Sanders have some things in common even though they sit on opposite ends of the political spectrum.

headline.main: Overflow Crowd for Donald Trump in Bernie Sanders’s Backyard
headline.print_headline: Overflow Crowd for Trump in the Backyard of Sanders
